the program is in the directory new_program1
the path is new_program1\enigma\hillclimb
the text to encode should be under the directory hillclimb

how to use the program: 
	
1. If you only know following: 
Rotor Setup: (reﬂector) ??? ??? IV III 
(keyboard) Initial Start 
Positions: ??? ??? B Q 
Ringstellung: 1 1 1 16 
Plugboard: ??? 
Reﬂector: C-Thin

and you want to know the whole config, 
you could input "./hillclimb filename" under new_program1\enigma\hillclimb
the file should under hillclimb directory
example: ./hillclimb ct.txt

after decode ct.txt
we can get the answer:

rotors: "Gamma", "VI", "IV", "III"
positions: "D", "A", "B", "Q"
plugboards: "MS", "KU", "FY", "AG", "BN", "PQ", "HJ", "DI", "ER", "LW"

and the result is: 
 

2. If you want to decode a text with the same settings, but you want to encode other texts
you could input "./newEnigma filename" under new_program1\enigma\hillclimb
the file should under hillclimb directory
example: ./newEnigma ct.txt


References:
1. https://github.com/emedvedev/enigma
I used his enigma emulator. Understood his code and used this program to encode text. My work is to use
algorithm to figure out the configuration of the enigma machine as fast as possible.

2. https://github.com/becgabri/enigma
I actually used this program because  the enigma simulator (github.com/emedvedev/enigma) 
has a bug in its code.
